"You

posts.raw_content:
We could ahve incentivised them to 'get along and integrate back to Russia' while in Ukraine.  It's better to keep them there than to bring them here.  We can offer "USAID" type programs that modernize farms over there.  The difference is we want a livecam and a website, reports, and instant FOIA fulfillment (10 days or less) and full transparency now.  Any laundering should be considered treason, because that's how you make it stop forever.  People should be scared to take such a job because of even the possibility of the optics of laundering (they would avoid doing things that might give the appearance of but not reality of money laundering).  

Anyone who didn't like the Russian takeover could have just left.  We (USA) should have taken them as asylees.  Eventually some would go back.  We'd give them a time limit during which time they can take ESL courses and if they become totally fluent and get a job, then they can apply for green card.  If they open a business, they can  immediately get a green card when they've contributed 100k in taxes.  In both situations they can get in line for naturalization.  

We fucked this country all up by fighting a proxy war with Russia.  The left pushed for it and now a bunch of people are fucking dead.

DEAD

Is it better to be subjugated by a country with integrity, who can make deals and generally makes its country satisfied if not super happy?  A country that is fair?  

I think it is.  We're not talking about slavery.  We're talking about "a country wins a war and gains the land and everything on it."

A more powerful country would not allow this natural activity to occur.  They stepped in, put their finger on the scales, and now we want to make deals with them.

If I were Russia, I'd say no contact ever again.  You won't let me in your clubs (NATO), no matter what we do, you always act like we're the enemy, even though you defeated us economically and caused us to become a modern country modeled after yours.  And all of this is because the UK has an irrational hatred of Russians, an ancient bigotry that I'm still trying to figure out.  And the UK, through its Renfield ISRAEL, has some kind of magic stranglehold over the United States.

Maybe its true that we DID lose America back to Britain in the war of 1812.  You never hear about this war, but they burned down our whitehouse and allegedly switched out our constitution and some other things.  The counci of trent was it?  It says that the UK owns all the seas of the world.  Maybe that's why.

Maybe we should revisit that, because UK powerbottoming the US and making it fight their wars for them just isn't going to work any more.

We've had enough of it.

It's time to hold UK accountable for their war crimes, Ukraine and in Israel, and people who make money and express extreme willingness to comply with them in our own US government.
posts.author: 5DchessWatch
posts.title: People in America one day will regret what we did to Russia during this conflict.  We should have let Russia win, from a humanitarian point of view.  Russia isn't 'soviet' or 'nazi'.  It would have been better for Ukraine to have been taken over by Russia and turned back to Russian
